medical_history.chief_complaint: Disseminated pruritic lesions described as 'bug bites' occurring from head to toe after sleeping in an abandoned building.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately two weeks prior to presentation, described as diffuse itching with a sensation of bugs crawling on his skin. The patient reported picking at the lesions in an attempt to rid himself of perceived bugs. He also admitted to experiencing auditory hallucinations and suicidal ideation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of schizophrenia with medication noncompliance for over 7 months; previous suicide attempt via heroin overdose four months ago.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is homeless, previously incarcerated from 2002–2005, during which he abstained from substance use. He reported using 3–4 bags of heroin intranasally daily and had a history of crack and cocaine use until one month prior.
